SENT.plain: Analysis of 19 cases of Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) with primary manifestation in gonads, diagnosed during 1984-1990 at AFIP Rawalpindi is presented
It constituted 10.4% of all extranodal lymphomas during the same period in this institute
Mean age at diagnosis was 60.4 years and only 11.4% cases were below 50 years of age
Majority of the patients reported early (mean duration was 4.2 months)
The mean tumour size was 3.2 cm
In a significant number of cases (43.5%)
Diffuse large cell lymphoma was the predominant (73.70%) subtype in testicular lymphoma
One case of Burkitt's lymphoma presenting as ovarian mass was also noted
Most of these cases (56.4%) were in le stage according to Ann Arbor staging
More clinical work-up is required to delineate the course of this entity in Pakistan
